subject: Re: [junit] minimum IJavaLaunchConfigurationConstants attribute required
msgSnippet: Hi Thanks for the reply. I am using DebugUITools.launch(configuration, ILaunchManager.RUN_MODE); For this method to run I check previously defined Junit
messageBody:
Hi

Thanks for the reply.

I am using DebugUITools.launch(configuration, ILaunchManager.RUN_MODE);
For this method to run I check previously defined Junit launching profiles or create new one if it does not exists. Now for this new configuration creation I may need to set up the configuration constants. I am using the following constant

ATTR_MAIN_TYPE_NAME
ATTR_PROJECT_NAME
ATTR_SOURCE_PATH

Now when I run DebugUITools.launch method nothing happens. Console prints all statement uptill this method but not after this.

Why I need to launch Junit programmatically : My program creates some junit test cases in run time workspace when I enable my plugin nature. Since these files are created at run time they do not have there respective class files in workspace. So I will call
project.refreshLocal(IResource.DEPTH_INFINITE, null);
project.build(IncrementalProjectBuilder.FULL_BUILD, null);

to build and refresh the runtime workspace.

My plugin have context menu to run these generated test cases and open junit plugin. When I click this menu option it will stop at DebugUITools.launch method.

I think one of the possible problem could be that since I am generating test case files at run time and not giving eclipse control to generate class files things might messed up with the classpath. I donot have clear idea why it is not working.

Junit configuration with same number of constant defined works fine if I create junit test case manually in run time workbench and then run the DebugUITools.launch method.

Any suggestion on this will be very helpful.

-Neelesh


David Saff <saff@...> wrote: Neelesh,

Have you tried the methods in JUnitLaunchShortcut? Even if you can't use
them directly, working through the source there will be a great starting
point for more information.

If that doesn't give you what you need, can you describe which method you're
calling, what you're trying to do, and what fails? Thanks,

David Saff

On 11/6/06, Neelesh Thakur <neeleshthakur101@...> wrote:
>
> Hi
>
> I am trying to launch the Junit launcher programmatically. For this I
> need to specify some IJavaLaunchConfigurationConstants attributes.
> Currently I am specifying
>
> ATTR_MAIN_TYPE_NAME
> ATTR_PROJECT_NAME
> ATTR_SOURCE_PATH
>
> Sometimes these many attributes works sometime not. Can anyone please
> tell me how many [minimum] of these constants required to be specified
> for launching.
>
> Thanks
> -Neelesh Thakur
>
>
>
>
>
>
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>
>
>
